org.magnos.asset
Class FutureAssetBundle

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.HashMap<String,FutureAsset<?>>
          org.magnos.asset.FutureAssetBundle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Map<String,FutureAsset<?>>
public class FutureAssetBundle
extends HashMap<String,FutureAsset<?>>

A bundle of FutureAssets to be loaded. This helps keep track of all assets loading in the background. 

 FutureAssetBundle bundle = new FutureAssetBundle();
 bundle.add( Assets.loadFuture("image.gif", BufferedImage.class) );
 bundle.add( Assets.loadFuture("sound.wav", Clip.class) );
 
 BufferedImage image = null;
 Clip sound = null;
 
 while (running) {
           // do stuff
     
     if (bundle.isComplete()) {
         bundle.loaded(); // notify all FutureAsset implementations the asset has been accepted.
         image = bundle.getAsset("image.gif");
         sound = bundle.getAsset("sound.wav");
         // move from loading to play screen
     } else {
         display bundle.percentComplete();     
     }
     
     // do other stuff
 }

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer
See Also:
FutureAsset, Serialized Form

FutureAssetBundle

public FutureAssetBundle()
Method Detail

countOf

public int countOf(FutureAssetStatus status)
Returns the count of FutureAssets in the given status.

Parameters:
status - The status to check for.
Returns:
The number of FutureAssets in the given status.

percentComplete

public float percentComplete()
Returns the percent complete (between 0.0 and 1.0).

Returns:
The percent complete.

hasCompleted

public boolean hasCompleted()
Returns whether this bundle of FutureAssets has finished loading. This method will return true if no assets are in the pending or loading status. Loaded, Failed, and Canceled assets are all considered completed.

Returns:
True if all assets have been processed.

loaded

public void loaded()
Calls loaded on all FutureAssets in this bundle. This should only be done once and when the user has checked for hasCompleted() and it returned true.

See Also:
FutureAsset.loaded()

load

public void load(boolean loadIfCanceled)
Calls FutureAsset.load(boolean) on all FutureAssets in this bundle.

Parameters:
loadIfCanceled - Whether the asset should be loaded if the FutureAsset has been canceled already. If true the asset will always be loaded, if false the asset will not be loaded if the status is canceled.

getAsset

public <A> A getAsset(String name)
Returns an asset with the given name. If none exists null is returned.

Parameters:
name - The name of the asset.
Returns:
The asset with the given name, or null if none exists.
Throws:
ClassCastException - The FutureAsset doesn't actually produce an asset of the expected type.

add

public void add(FutureAsset<?> futureAsset)
Adds the futureAsset to this bundle using the request as the key.

Parameters:
futureAsset - The FutureAsset to add to the bundle.

cancel

public int cancel()
Tries to cancel all FutureAssets and returns the number successfully canceled.

Returns:
The number of FutureAssets successfully canceled.
